The set of all possible error codes

#define VA_ENC_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_BITSTREAM_WRITER   (-1)
 An invalid bitstream writer handle was supplied.
#define VA_ENC_STATUS_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE   (-2)
 An invalid/unsupported parameter value was supplied.
#define VA_ENC_STATUS_ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW   (-3)
 A buffer overflow has occurred.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum VAEncBitstreamAttribType

Bitstream writer attribute types.

Enumerator:
VAEncBitstreamAttribBuffer 

User-provided buffer to hold output bitstream (pointer).

If this attribute is provided, then VAencBitstreamAttribBufferSize shall also be supplied or va_enc_bitstream_new() will ignore that attribute and allocate its own buffer.

VAEncBitstreamAttribBufferSize 

Size of the user-provided buffer (integer).

VAEncBitstreamAttribFlushFunc 

User-provided flush() callback (pointer-to-function).

VAEncBitstreamAttribMiscMask 

Placeholder for codec-specific attributes.

Function Documentation

int va_enc_bitstream_align ( VAEncBitstream *  bs,
unsigned int  value 
)

Byte aligns the bitstream.

Align the bitstream to next byte boundary, while filling in bits with the specified value (0 or 1).

Parameters:
[in]bsthe bitstream writer
[in]valuethe bit filler value (0 or 1)
Returns:
the number of bits written, or a negative value to indicate an error
void va_enc_bitstream_destroy ( VAEncBitstream *  bs)

Destroys a bitstream writer.

Parameters:
[in]bsthe bitstream writer to destroy
int va_enc_bitstream_flush ( VAEncBitstream *  bs)

Flushes the bitstream.

Flushes the bitstream, while padding with zeroe's up to the next byte boundary. This functions resets the bitstream writer to its initial state. If the user provided a flush function through the VAEncBitstreamFlushFunc attribute, then his callback will be called.

Parameters:
[in]bsthe bitstream writer
Returns:
the number of bytes written, or a negative value to indicate an error
VAEncBitstream* va_enc_bitstream_new ( VAEncBitstreamAttrib *  attribs,
unsigned int  num_attribs 
)

Allocates a new bitstream writer.

Allocates a new bitstream writer. By default, libva allocates and maintains its own buffer. However, the user can pass down his own buffer with the VAEncBitstreamAttribBuffer attribute, along with the size of that buffer with the VAEncBitstreamAttribBufferSize attribute.

Parameters:
[in]attribsthe optional attributes, or NULL
[in]num_attribsthe number of attributes available in attribs
Returns:
a new VAEncBitstream, or NULL if an error occurred
int va_enc_bitstream_write_si ( VAEncBitstream *  bs,
int  value,
int  length 
)

Writes a signed integer.

Writes a signed int value of the specified length in bits. The value is implicitly sign-extended to the number of specified bits.

Parameters:
[in]bsthe bitstream writer
[in]valuethe signed int value to write
[in]lengththe length (in bits) of the value
Returns:
the number of bits written, or a negative value to indicate an error
int va_enc_bitstream_write_ui ( VAEncBitstream *  bs,
unsigned int  value,
int  length 
)

Writes an unsigned integer.

Writes an unsigned int value of the specified length in bits. The value is implicitly zero-extended to the number of specified bits.

Parameters:
[in]bsthe bitstream writer
[in]valuethe unsigned int value to write
[in]lengththe length (in bits) of the value
Returns:
the number of bits written, or a negative value to indicate an error
